docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats in the conservative Deep South are looking to recapture some old political magic in the 2014 elections.

headline.main: Deep South Dems Mount Comeback With Familiar Names
headline.print_headline: Deep South Dems Mount Comeback With Familiar Names

docs.lead_paragraph: FRIEDMAN--Herbert V., born November 2, 1918, cherished husband of more than 70 years of Marion (nee Rosenfeld), adored father of Barbara Altman (Ron) and Ken (Joanne), beloved grandpa of Andrew Altman, Lynn Altman, Melissa Wolfson, and Jeff Wolfson, and superpappy of Hannah, Brent, and Jared Wolfson. After graduating from NYU, Heights in 1939 and Columbia Law School in 1942, Herb enlisted in the Army Air Corps. Following the war and the birth of their children, he and Marion made their home in Rockville Centre, NY, for 55 years, joining Central Synagogue of Nassau County and becoming founding members of Middle Bay Country Club in 1955. A lifetime member of the Million Dollar Round Table, Herb established an extraordinarily successful insurance business, specializing in association group and group health insurance. An avid golfer, Herb had six holes in one, scoring his last one at age 88. In addition to golf and a good gin game, Herb loved going out with Marion and family and friends, to enjoy a great meal, a good martini, and lots of laughs. All who knew him delighted in his upbeat personality, his joie de vivre, his warmth, and his sense of humor. His smile was magnificent and his laughter contagious. Services are private. In lieu of flowers, a donation to your favorite charity would be appreciated.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is taking its mission to radio shows, churches and YouTube to urge people to buy health insurance ahead of the March 31 deadline.

headline.main: Administration Plays to Young in Health Push
headline.print_headline: Administration Plays to Young in Health Push

docs.abstract: Obama administration is rolling out aggressive push to get young people, especially African-Americans and Latinos, to buy health insurance through HealthCare.gov ahead of March 31 deadline; effort, including sports-themed internet portal and visits to radio shows and churches nationwide, underscores just how important success of the Affordable Care Act is to Pres Obama's political legacy.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration is taking its mission to radio shows, churches and YouTube to urge people to buy health insurance ahead of the March 31 deadline.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mississippi Republican Thad Cochran is facing his toughest primary challenge in nearly 36 years in the Senate, from a tea party favorite who casts him as an out-of-touch Washington insider. But Cochran is meeting state lawmaker Chris McDaniel's barbs with a potent weapon: the Barbour family's political machine.

headline.main: Opponents of China Trade Deal Occupy Taiwan's Legislature
headline.print_headline: Trade Deal Spurs Protest in Taiwan

docs.abstract: Protesters said the trade act would “forfeit Taiwan’s future” and accused President Ma Ying-jeou of forcing through the measure without allowing a review of its details.
docs.snippet: Protesters said the trade act would “forfeit Taiwan’s future” and accused President Ma Ying-jeou of forcing through the measure without allowing a review of its details.

headline.main: Insurers Seek to Capitalize on China's Smog

docs.abstract: Financial institutions are finding opportunities amid China’s recently announced “war against pollution,” with insurers offering payouts to travelers and residents on pollution-choked days.
docs.snippet: Financial institutions are finding opportunities amid China’s recently announced “war against pollution,” with insurers offering payouts to travelers and residents on pollution-choked days.
